newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee gains mildly vs spot, forward dlr.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee gains mildly vs spot, forward dlr.

text.p: The Indian rupee gained mildly against the spot and forward dollar on Monday, dealers said.
"The dollar touched a low of 35.780 rupees," said a dealer.
"This was the level at which RBI (Reserve Bank of India) bought dollars last week," he said. The RBI was not active on Monday.
Spot rupee opened steady on Monday at 35.78/79.
There was little demand for dollars on the first working day of the new month amid good supply.
The forward premiums slipped, tracking an easing of call rates, dealers said.
"Exporters continue to sell dollars forward to avail of available premiums," said a dealer.
"Premiums may go down to 4.25 percent but that may be the bottom for now," said a dealer at a foreign bank.
He said the government may announce a bond auction next week and June 15 would see some tax outflow from banks.
"After all is said and done, the upside is absolutely limited, and 4.8/4.9 percent (six month annualised premium) should be a safe cap," the dealer said.
